intro: Sebastiania bicalcarata, commonly known as the two-keeled sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, brightly colored aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
